SYSTEM: ReReNORAthens.v1-boris.pdf: Página 10
Non-Ontological Resource
State of the Art
•
Non-Ontological Resource (NOR) is an existing knowledge resource 
whose semantics has not yet been formalized by an ontology.
Data Structure Level (Maedche et al. 2001)
Unstructured
Semi-structured
Structured
Level of explicitness and formalization
(Gangemi et al. 1998)
Catalogue of normalized terms
Glossed Catalogue
Taxonomy
Terms Lists
• Authority files
• Glossaries
• Dictionaries
Forms of representation models
(Hodge 2000)
• Gazetteers
• Lexicons
Classification and categories
• Subject headings
(Hodge 2000)
• Classification schemes, 
• taxonomies and 
• categorization schemes
Relationship lists
10
© A Method for Reusing and Re-engineering Non-Ontological Resources for Building Ontologies 
Boris Villazón-Terrazas
• Thesauri
• Semantic Newtorks
speaker: SYSTEM
